headline: Wells Fargo (WFC): Assessing Valuation After Strong Q3 Results and Asset Cap Removal
summary: Wells Fargo (WFC) grabbed attention after delivering third-quarter results that surpassed forecasts, driven by loan growth, rising investment banking fees, and strength in consumer lending. The recent end to its Federal Reserve asset cap means new expansion opportunities. See our latest analysis for Wells Fargo. Wells Fargo’s momentum is showing up not just in earnings, but in the numbers too. A 19.5% share price return year-to-date and a 32.8% total shareholder return over the past year...

headline: Jim Cramer Says Wells Fargo Earnings Indicated “Credit Quality Was Very Strong”
summary: Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE:WFC) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer recently highlighted. Discussing the stock during the episode, Cramer said: “Now, we got earnings from the big financials last week, and I was quite heartened by what they had to say. Wells Fargo put up extraordinary numbers, indicating credit quality was very strong.” […]
